text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
MedicinalProductDefinition 0..*MedicinalProductDefinitionDetailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, drug catalogs)
identifier 1..*IdentifierBusiness identifier for this product. Could be an MPID
system 1..1uriThe namespace for the identifier value
Binding: MedicinalProductDefinition identifier systems (extensible)
value 1..1stringThe value that is unique
type 0..1CodeableConceptRegulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized
Binding: MedicinalProductType (extensible)
domain 0..1CodeableConceptIf this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses
Binding: MedicinalProductDomain (extensible)
coding 1..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
version 0..1stringBusiness version of this product
status 0..1CodeableConceptThe status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status
Binding: PublicationStatus (extensible)
statusDate 0..1dateTimeThe date at which this status became applicable.
description 0..1markdownGeneral description of the product referred by the ePI
combinedPharmaceuticalDoseForm 0..1CodeableConceptThe dose form for a single part product or combined form of a multiple part product
route 0..*CodeableConceptRoute of administration
indication 0..1markdownDescription of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required.
legalStatusOfSupply 0..1CodeableConceptThe legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator
Example SPOR example: {"coding":[{"system":"https://spor.ema.europa.eu/rmswi","code":"100000072084","display":"Medicinal product subject to medical prescription"}]}
coding 1..*CodingCode defined by a terminology system
additionalMonitoringIndicator 0..1CodeableConceptAdditional monitoring this Medicinal Product is subject to (for regulatory reasons)
pediatricUseIndicator 0..1CodeableConceptAuthorised pediatric use
classification 0..*CodeableConceptClassifications used for this product
marketingStatus 0..*MarketingStatusMarketing status of the medicinal product in contrast to marketing authorization
packagedMedicinalProduct 0..*CodeableConceptPackage type for this product
name
productName 1..1stringThe full name of this product
Example general: Humalog Mix50 Insulin KwikPen, 3ml pre-fill
type 0..1CodeableConceptType of product name, such as rINN, BAN, Proprietary, Non-Proprietary
Example SPOR example: {"coding":[{"system":"https://spor.ema.europa.eu/rmswi","code":"220000000001","display":"Full name"}]}
namePart
part 1..1stringA fragment of a product name
Example general: Humalog
type 1..1CodeableConceptIdentifying type for this part of the name (e.g. strength part)
Example SPOR example: {"coding":[{"system":"https://spor.ema.europa.eu/rmswi","code":"220000000002","display":"Invented name part"}]}
countryLanguage
country 1..1CodeableConceptCountry for where this name applies (code)
language 1..1CodeableConceptLanguage for this name (code)

Documentation for this format

element.short: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, drug catalogs)
element.definition: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, drug catalogs).

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

mapping.map: Medicinal Product and Investigational Medicinal Product

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: Typically, the resource has an id except for cases like the create operation, conditional updates.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://build.fhir.org/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID
element.definition: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)
element.definition: The purpose of this identifier.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.
element.requirements: Allows the appropriate identifier for a particular context of use to be selected from among a set of identifiers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary id for a permanent one.

extension.valueString: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

element.short: Description of identifier
element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.comment: This element deals only with general categories of identifiers.  It SHOULD not be used for codes that correspond 1..1 with the Identifier.system. Some identifiers may fall into multiple categories due to common usage.   Where the system is known, a type is unnecessary because the type is always part of the system definition. However systems often need to handle identifiers where the system is not known. There is not a 1:1 relationship between type and system, since many different systems have the same type.
element.requirements: Allows users to make use of identifiers when the identifier system is not known.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

extension.valueString: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

element.short: The namespace for the identifier value
element.definition: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.
element.comment: Identifier.system is always case sensitive.
element.requirements: There are many sets  of identifiers.  To perform matching of two identifiers, we need to know what set we're dealing with. The system identifies a particular set of unique identifiers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The value that is unique
element.definition: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.
element.comment: If the value is a full URI, then the system SHALL be urn:ietf:rfc:3986.  The value's primary purpose is computational mapping.  As a result, it may be normalized for comparison purposes (e.g. removing non-significant whitespace, dashes, etc.)  A value formatted for human display can be conveyed using the [Rendered Value extension](http://build.fhir.org/extension-rendered-value.html). Identifier.value is to be treated as case sensitive unless knowledge of the Identifier.system allows the processer to be confident that non-case-sensitive processing is safe.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: II.extension or II.root if system indicates OID or GUID (Or Role.id.extension or root)

element.short: Time period when id is/was valid for use
element.definition: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Organization that issued id (may be just text)
element.definition: Organization that issued/manages the identifier.
element.comment: The Identifier.assigner may omit the .reference element and only contain a .display element reflecting the name or other textual information about the assigning organization.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: II.assigningAuthorityName but note that this is an improper use by the definition of the field.  Also Role.scoper

element.short: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized
element.definition: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (indicates if this is Medicinal Product or an Investigational Medicinal Product)

element.short: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses
element.definition: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: Business version of this product
element.definition: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status
element.definition: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that can indicate that a record should not be treated as valid

element.short: The date at which this status became applicable.
element.definition: The date at which the given status became applicable.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: General description of the product referred by the ePI
element.definition: General description of this product.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The dose form for a single part product or combined form of a multiple part product
element.definition: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Dose forms for a product as a whole, considering all individual parts, but before any mixing

element.short: Route of administration
element.definition: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a patient's body.

element.short: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required.
element.definition: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: (roll up of all text in Therapeutic Indication.Indication Text, for common case where information is not granular)

element.short: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator
element.definition: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

coding.display: Medicinal product subject to medical prescription

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

mapping.map: Marketing Authorisation.Legal Status of Supply (moved here for practicality)

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

element.short: Additional monitoring this Medicinal Product is subject to (for regulatory reasons)
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons
element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Authorised pediatric use
element.definition: If authorised for use in children.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Classifications used for this product
element.definition: Allows the product to be classified by various systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Marketing status of the medicinal product in contrast to marketing authorization
element.definition: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Package type for this product
element.definition: Package representation for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes
element.definition: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Medicinal Product.Ingredient (see also FHIR Ingredient resource)

element.short: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products
element.definition: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product
element.definition: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)
element.definition: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization
element.definition: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Allows the contact to be classified, for example QPPV, Pharmacovigilance Enquiry Information
element.definition: Allows the contact to be classified, for example QPPV, Pharmacovigilance Enquiry Information.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization
element.definition: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in
element.definition: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A code that this product is known by, within some formal terminology
element.definition: A code that this product is known by, usually within some formal terminology. Products (types of medications) tend to be known by identifiers during development and within regulatory process. However when they are prescribed they tend to be identified by codes. The same product may be have multiple codes, applied to it by multiple organizations.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A coded concept that defines the type of a medication.

element.short: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts
element.definition: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
